messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] traveling/audio ideas needed
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/13/2003 9:25:27 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Two of my favorite books on tape are:  To Kill a Mockingbird...the lady who reads it is
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/13/2003 9:25:27 PM Eastern Standard Time,
regstehe@... writes:

> <<It is almost time for our next trip to Tn and this visit I will be
> leaving the kids with the grandparents for about 2 weeks. I want to
> get lots of stuff to keep me company on the way home and then going
> back (12 hours each way). >>

Two of my favorite books on tape are: To Kill a Mockingbird...the lady who
reads it is WONDERFUL...such a full range of different voices, and the kids
loved it.

And the second is "Memoirs of a Geisha" I LOVED that story....it's such an
education in what a real Geisha was...so many people think prostitute. What an
eye opener.

Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] traveling/audio ideas needed
messages.msgSnippet: David Whyte s, Clear Minds Wild Hearts Smashing good discussion of writing poetry and life s learning. Smashing! My (affected English accent) thots Tim T ...
messages.messageBody:
David Whyte's, Clear Minds Wild Hearts

Smashing good discussion of writing poetry and life's learning.

Smashing!

My (affected English accent) thots

Tim T
----- Original Message -----
From: regstehe@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, June 13, 2003 6:23 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] traveling/audio ideas needed


I would get a book on tape for adults. I'm listening to Diana Gabaldon's The
Fiery Cross right now. There are 40 tapes to that one. It would probably
take you there and back and beyond.
Regina

<<It is almost time for our next trip to Tn and this visit I will be
leaving the kids with the grandparents for about 2 weeks. I want to
get lots of stuff to keep me company on the way home and then going
back (12 hours each way). >>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] traveling/audio ideas needed
messages.msgSnippet: **On my list already are Sandra s parenting tapes...any other ideas???!!! ** PamS has tapes from her two workshops on Mathematical Joy.  Those ll fire up your
messages.messageBody:
**On my list already are
Sandra's parenting tapes...any other ideas???!!! **

PamS has tapes from her two workshops on Mathematical Joy. Those'll
fire up your brain. Also available from www.hsc.org is a keynote speech
by Linda Dobson on Homeschooling Success Stories. I find that to be
nicely cheerful and uplifting.

I personally love talk radio, so you can download radio programs on
topics of interest from www.npr.org, if you have the right technology to
transfer it to your car.

Betsy

messages.subject: traveling/audio ideas needed
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, It is almost time for our next trip to Tn and this visit I will be leaving the kids with the grandparents for about 2 weeks.  I want to get lots of
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,

It is almost time for our next trip to Tn and this visit I will be
leaving the kids with the grandparents for about 2 weeks. I want to
get lots of stuff to keep me company on the way home and then going
back (12 hours each way). I get soooo bored without the kids. The
kids and I usually do book tapes and some fun older and newer rock
music. What should I get for JUST ME!!! On my list already are
Sandra's parenting tapes...any other ideas???!!!
Thanks,
Beth in MD (looking for unschooling/postive parenting gems on tape)
